title: Campus as Inspiration exhibition
summary: This exhibition highlights artistic responses in the medium of dance, sound and photography to portray the experience of being at Stirling.
timeAdvice: Open Monday to Friday 09:00 to 17:00

title: Inspired! exhibition
summary: In 2023-24 our chosen focus is Inspired! in which we celebrate how our campus and collections have inspired creativity.
timeAdvice: Open Monday to Friday 09:00 to 17:00

title: The Art of Willie Rodger exhibition
summary: See the works and the art that was inspired by established printmaker Willie Rodger in this exhibition.
timeAdvice: Open Monday to Friday 09:00 to 17:00

title: Interior Dialogue exhibition
summary: Explore three pieces of work by Scottish artist Christine Borland at this exhibition in Pathfoot Building.
timeAdvice: Monday to Friday

title: Movement exhibition
summary: Our Movement exhibition displays previously unseen artworks and archive material from our Collections which represent the kinetic energy and joy of movement in a variety of surprising ways.

title: Art Collection Open Day
summary: Come along to our Open Day to find out more about this year’s theme 'Inspired! Campus and Collections as Inspiration'.

title: Lino Print Workshop with Abbie Lois
summary: Spend an afternoon learning to lino print - suitable for beginners!

title: Campus Photography Workshop with Michael Prince
summary: Be inspired with our guided photography walk around the beautiful University of Stirling campus.

title: Curator’s Tour
summary: Join the Art Collection team for a relaxed and free tour of the current exhibitions.

title: Family Friendly Collage
summary: Create a mini postcard-sized collage and be inspired by our artists' incredible collection.

title: Nordic Viola – The Pathfoot Project Performance
summary: Students from the University of Stirling and the Royal Conservatoire of Scotland have come together to create work inspired by the exhibitions, and are joined by ensemble Nordic Viola.

title: Memoria Exhibition Launch
summary: Our Open Day will conclude with the formal opening of a new exhibition Memoria by University Artist in Residence Audrey Grant.

title: Memoria Exhibition
summary: Developed over Audrey Grant's year-long residency, Memoria considers and responds to the visible and invisible traces left in the landscape of the historic Airthrey Estate

title: Last chance curator’s tour
summary: Join the Art Collection curators for a last-chance tour of our Inspired! Exhibitions in the Pathfoot Building.

title: Faculty of Taking Notice Assembly: Meet our Artists in Residence
summary: Meet the University of Stirling Artists in Residence for 2024-25, Gardner & Gardner,  a husband and wife artist duo, at the Crush Hall.

title: History, Heritage and Politics seminars
summary: Join our programme of History, Heritage and Politics seminars and learn about the latest research from University experts and guest speakers.

title: Massacre at Agincourt: Comics Medievalism, the Battle of Agincourt, and the Korean War
summary: Come along to Massacre at Agincourt and hear from speaker Iain MacInnes from University of the Highlands and Islands.
location: Hybrid: Room P.Sc2 and via Microsoft Teams

title: Legal Sightseeing
summary: Legal Sightseeing webinar features speaker Renske Vos from Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam.
location: Hybrid: Room P.Sc2 and via Microsoft Teams

title: Stirling PhD Publications
summary: Join the Stirling PhD Publications webinar with speakers Elizabeth Robson and Jamie Macpherson from University of Stirling.
location: Hybrid: Room P.Sc2 and via Microsoft Teams

title: Dumyat Hill Race
summary: The Dumyat Hill Race is the University of Stirling's flagship running event, and a popular fixture on the Scottish hill running calendar.

title: Postgraduate Open Day
summary: Our Postgraduate Open Days give you the perfect opportunity to find out more about studying at Stirling.

title: Virtual Postgraduate Open Day
summary: Our Virtual Open Day features a mix of presentations, videos and live chat. It also includes our virtual tour, which showcases our beautiful campus and facilities.

title: III Symposium on Current Trends in Consumer Research
summary: Join our III Symposium on Current Trends in Consumer Research hosted by Professor Cele Otnes at University of Stirling in May 2024.
location: Stirling Court Hotel, University of Stirling

title: Iain (M) Banks: Two Authors, One Man Exhibition Launch
summary: Learn about the life and legacy of one of our University's most renowned alumni. Enjoy free food, giveaways and creative activities at this launch event.

title: Screened Out
summary: Screened Out is a film and workshop programme that focusses on queer representation within modern cinema.
location: Creative Stirling Venue, 44 King Street, Stirling FK8 1AY
timeAdvice: Events take place across three dates. See programme for full time details

title: Scottish International Law Conference 2024: Human Rights Incorporation
summary: The 2024 edition of the Scottish International Law Conference series will focus on the theme of 'Human Rights Incorporation', exploring the incorporation of international human rights obligations into national law.

title: Undergraduate Open Day September 2025
summary: An Undergraduate Open Day is your golden opportunity to find out everything there is to know about life at the University of Stirling.

title: ESRC Festival of Social Science 2024
summary: University of Stirling researchers are putting on an exciting programme of interactive public events as part of the ESRC Festival of Social Science 2024, the UK’s biggest celebration of social science research.
location: Various locations across Stirling and central Scotland

title: Science of steps - a creative walk through nature revealing the science behind the benefits of a short stroll
summary: We all know how hard it can be to be physically active. This creative event will show how small changes in our daily physical activity can make a difference to our wellbeing and fitness. Learn about our physical activity research while walking a lap of the loch, exploring the beautiful surroundings of University of Stirling campus.
location: Crush Hall, Pathfoot Building, University of Stirling, FK9 4LA

title: Technology Taster Session for Seniors
summary: Have you ever wanted to try a new technology without having to buy it? If so then our drop-in session is perfect for you. Anyone over the age of 65 can come along to visit different stations and try a vast array of digital technologies.
location: Ramoyle Room, Braeport Centre, Dunblane, FK15 0AT

title: Hopetown 2040 - Tackling a 'Tomorrow Problem'
summary: Come and play a serious game about tackling the ‘tomorrow problem’ of healthy ageing. Players will join teams to make decisions about services, housing and care for the residents of Hopetown. It's a fun way to experience the challenges and solutions of developing communities that support healthy ageing, which is a ‘tomorrow problem’ that will affect us all!
location: Iris Murdoch Building, University of Stirling, Stirling, FK9 4NF

title: Exploring our automated futures - AI, data and surveillance
summary: This two-hour interactive event offers a creative space to inform and critically explore issues and opportunities arising from digitally-mediated surveillance practices and systems which assist (or complicate) professional decision-making, strategy, and action across all sectors of human endeavour.
location: Room 2A13, Cottrell Building, University of Stirling, Stirling, FK9 4LA

title: Our Digital Bodies - Biometric Technologies and Data
summary: This interactive event offers a creative and collaborative space for citizens to share their perspectives on ‘Our Digital Bodies’ by exploring current and future uses of biometrics.
location: Queen Margaret Room, Dunfermline Carnegie Library and Galleries (DCLG), 1-7 Abbot Street, Dunfermline, KY12 7NL

title: Intergenerational digital ideas swap shop
summary: This two-hour workshop will offer a mix of in-person, online and hybrid activities to explore the idea of resilience and to share our experience of using technology to stay well and happy in our everyday lives.
location: In-person at the Iris Murdoch Building, University of Stirling, FK9 4NF or online

title: Autism through an Autistic Lens
summary: This event aims to bust common myths and stereotypes about autism. It includes a 45-minute interactive research talk by Sarah Dantas (event leader and main researcher) introducing the research project ‘Autism through an Autistic Lens’. The project engaged autistic adults in creatively expressing their experiences through photography.
location: Stirling Central Library, Corn Exchange Road, Stirling, FK8 2HX

title: After the Landslide - where next for UK politics and policy?
summary: This event brings together a panel of leading academic experts, activists, and thought leaders to reflect on the big challenges facing UK and devolved politicians over the coming quarter century.
location: Stirling Smith Art Gallery, 40 Albert Pl, Stirling, FK8 2RQ

title: Voting women - women’s voices and political participation in Scotland from Parliament to Indyref and beyond
summary: This event will combine discussions on Scotland’s recent political history – from the Scottish Parliament to Indyref and recent political events – and creative reflections on political voice from and for women.

title: Hidden Histories - digital approaches to the ‘lost’ stories of Alloa
summary: The exhibition is focused on bringing to life, through images and sounds, the experiences of older people who grew up in Alloa and the surrounding areas. It captures their life stories and through them will demonstrate the different ways that Alloa has changed in the last 120 years.
location: The Alloa Hub, Maple Court, Alloa FK10 1JX

title: Exploring Big Ideas - engaging with philosophy with children
summary: This event is for invited schools only. It's a practical philosophy session using a Community of Philosophical Inquiry (CoPI) approach exploring the festival theme of "Our Digital Lives".
location: Iris Murdoch Building, University of Stirling, FK9 4NF and online

title: Undergraduate Open Day November 2025
summary: An Undergraduate Open Day is your golden opportunity to find out everything there is to know about life at the University of Stirling.

title: Online Undergraduate Information Sessions
summary: At our online sessions we’ll take you through everything from advice on applying to funding your studies, and you'll hear from current students about living and studying at Stirling.

title: This Fragile Earth: Pioneer Scottish Artists who anticipated the climate crisis
summary: This exhibition focusses on a group of pioneering Scottish artists who as early as the 1970s and 1980s were responding to the threat of climate change.
timeAdvice: Galleries are open Monday – Friday, 09:00-17:00 or by appointment.

title: The Divine Sky - Sekai Machache
summary: Sekai Machache (she/they) is a Zimbabwean-Scottish visual artist and curator based in Glasgow. Her work is a deep interrogation of the notion of self and she is interested in the relationship between spirituality, imagination and the role of the artist in disseminating symbolic imagery to provide a space for healing.
timeAdvice: Galleries are open Monday – Friday, 09:00-17:00 or by appointment.

title: Remembering Together: Collective Creative Responses to the Pandemic
summary: This exhibition explores how two separate projects chose to make sense of the pandemic, reflecting on how we as a society remember and honour traumatic times.
timeAdvice: Galleries are open Monday – Friday, 09:00-17:00 or by appointment.

title: Margaret Mitchell: Six Works
summary: This series of six works, acquired by the University’s Art Collection in 2023, focus on Margaret Mitchell's nephew Steven, offering an insight into his life’s trajectory.
timeAdvice: Galleries are open Monday – Friday, 09:00-17:00 or by appointment.

title: A Sense of Place
summary: Explore a small exhibition of artworks in the Iris Murdoch Building, organised by the Art Collection and chosen from the University’s permanent collection.

title: Seven Women: Ken Currie
summary: In 2023 the University Art Collection was delighted to be gifted seven works by renowned artist Ken Currie and we are pleased to display Seven Women together in this exhibition.
timeAdvice: Galleries are open Monday – Friday, 09:00-17:00 or by appointment.

title: Artist Talk: Margaret Mitchell
summary: In collaboration with the Stirling Photography Festival, Margaret will lead a talk exploring her practice and approach as well as offering us a first look at her work in the university collection.

title: Warm welcome to the Art Collection
summary: Come along to our Art Collection for an introduction to our collections, look around our store and see some hidden gems in our collection.

title: Doors Open Day
summary: Explore the iconic Pathfoot Building as part of Doors Open Day 2024.

title: Memoria
summary: Developed over the course of Audrey Grant's year-long residency, Memoria explores the visible and invisible traces left on the historic Airthrey Estate landscape.
timeAdvice: Monday - Friday

title: This Fragile Earth exhibition launch
summary: Join the University of Stirling Art Collection and the Fleming Collection to celebrate the launch of This Fragile Earth: How Scottish Artists Anticipated the Climate Crisis.

title: This Fragile Earth: creative writing workshops
summary: We want to get people thinking and writing about the earth and what matters to them. Everyone is welcome to join our creative writing workshop.

title: John Craxton: A Life of Gifts film screening
summary: A film screening and discussion of John Craxton: A Life of Gifts, a painter born into a famous musical family in 1922.

title: Education, the Arts and Climate Change
summary: This in-person event, hosted by the Stirling Centre for Research into Curriculum Making and Stirling University’s Art Collection, will explore the challenges and affordances of education that respond to the affective dimensions of living on a Fragile Earth.

title: Viewing Rooms: Elizabeth Blackadder and John Houston
summary: See artwork that would normally live in our art store, at our art collection as part of our Viewing Rooms series. In January, come along and see the works of married couple Blackadder and Houston.

title: A warm welcome to the Art Collection
summary: Visit our collections, see the exhibitions and learn about what's coming up on the Art Collection calendar. Everyone is welcome to join us.

title: On A Wing And A Prayer: a day of workshops and performance
summary: A day of sound and workshops to celebrate the launch of the album, On A Wing and A Prayer.

title: Sashiko Stitching Workshop
summary: Inspired by the Japanese technique of Sashiko, join teacher Sue Crawley for a relaxed evening of slow stitching.

title: The Winston Smith Library of Victory and Truth
summary: Visit The Library - a visual art installation with 1,984 copies of the iconic 1984 novel by George Orwell.

title: Into the Oceanic: documentary screening
summary: Into the Oceanic is a documentary featuring two films by Elizabeth Ogilvie and Robert Page who collaborated with world-class scientists.

title: 900 years of the burgh of Stirling
summary: This exhibition celebrates the 900th anniversary since Stirling was founded as a Royal Burgh - it celebrates the history of the town and its cultural heritage.

title: Viewing Rooms: 1967
summary: Our Viewing Rooms are a chance to see works that aren't normally on display, this month's focus is 1967 - the year the University of Stirling opened.

title: Postgraduate Webinar Season
summary: Learn more about what it’s like to be a postgraduate student at the University of Stirling. At our online sessions we’ll take you through everything from advice on studying with us, the support we provide and preparing for your career after graduating.

title: Postgraduate Webinar Season: Accommodation Information Session
summary: Join our Accommodation Team for an insightful session on everything you need to know about student housing.

title: Postgraduate Webinar Season: Careers and Employability Information Session
summary: Join our Careers and Employability Team to learn everything you need to know about the support they can provide you.

title: Postgraduate Webinar Season: Student Immigration Team Information Session
summary: Join our Student Immigration Team to learn more about the student visa process.

title: Postgraduate Webinar Season: Student Support Services Information Session
summary: Join our Student Support Services to learn more about the extensive range of support services they provide to help you fulfil your potential and make the most of your time studying with us.

title: Challenges and the Future of Minority and Indigenous Rights Protection Conference
summary: This conference will reflect on the rights of indigenous peoples and ethnic, religious and linguistic minorities, and the need to fundamentally rethink and recommit to their protection.
tags: Faculty of Arts and Humanities, Sustainability

title: History, Heritage and Politics seminars
summary: Join our programme of History, Heritage and Politics seminars and learn about the latest research from University experts and guest speakers.

title: Visualising the Urban Climate Crisis in Uganda
summary: Join speaker Dr Neil Crawford from the University of Stirling's research seminar on Visualising the Urban Climate Crisis in Uganda.
location: Hybrid in room Pathfoot H3 and online via Microsoft Teams

title: Giving Us Voice
summary: Join speaker Dr Annalisa Christie from the University of Stirling and chair Dr Jennie Morgan from the University of Stirling on the subject of Introducing 'Giving Us Voice'.
location: Hybrid in Room H3, Pathfoot Building, and online via Microsoft Teams

title: Churchill, Chamberlain and Appeasement
summary: Join speaker Professor Emer George Peden and respondent Associate Professor Ian Cawood from the University of Stirling for this research seminar on Churchill, Chamberlain and Appeasement.
location: Hybrid in Room H3, Pathfoot Building and online via Microsoft Teams.

title: Dr Bike
summary: Pop along for free bike checks and repairs! No need to book just bring your bike along. Any larger repairs can be advised and then booked into the Recyke-a-bike shop.

summary: Pop along for free bike checks and repairs! No need to book just bring your bike along. Any larger repairs can be advised and then booked into the Recyke-a-bike shop.

title: Ian Cawood on 'Rethinking radicalism in nineteenth-century print culture'
summary: Join Ian Cawood's seminar on 'Rethinking radicalism in nineteenth-century print culture'.

title: Laurel Forster on 'Activism and Agency in Feminist Magazines'
summary: Join Laurel Forster (University of Plymouth)'s seminar on 'Activism and Agency in Feminist Magazines'

title: Difficult monuments in theory and practice: the Nazi Monument at Stiklestad, Norway
isSeriesChild: Centre for Environment Heritage and Policy Seminar Series
summary: Join this talk by Torgrim Sneve Guttormsen as he discusses topics of heritage that are contentious and examines how public monuments become the focus of attention.
location: Online via Microsoft Teams, and in person at Room P.C22, Pathfoot Building

title: The era of climate capitalism and climate colonialism? A critical analysis of global climate finance governance
isSeriesChild: Centre for Environment Heritage and Policy Seminar Series
summary: Dr Hyeyoon Park introduces emerging issues of global inequality and justice in global climate finance governance in this seminar.

title: Working together to improve air quality: case studies from the UK and Kenya
isSeriesChild: Centre for Environment Heritage and Policy Seminar Series
summary: Join this lunchtime seminar on working together to improve air quality presented by Dr Heather Price.

title: Being there. Inscription as memory practice in tourism and heritage
isSeriesChild: Centre for Environment Heritage and Policy Seminar Series
summary: Dr Sarah May considers how and why we inscribe ourselves into places that matter in this seminar.

title: Understanding seascapes as heritage-making geographies: the floating populations of Macao, in the Southeast Coast of China
isSeriesChild: Centre for Environment Heritage and Policy Seminar Series
summary: The effects migrations between seascapes and landscapes have on heritage processes are discussed in this seminar presented by Mariana Pinto Leitão Pereira.

title: Probing beneath the surface: an object-driven research approach to unsettle established narratives in a maritime collection
isSeriesChild: Centre for Environment Heritage and Policy Seminar Series
summary: Probing beneath the surface draws on Alina Botezatu's work on unearthing hidden stories of the Trinity House of Leith and its maritime collection.

title: Refugee Housing, Asylum Politics, and Barking Madness: Lessons from Germany
isSeriesChild: Centre for Environment Heritage and Policy Seminar Series
summary: Join speaker Eli Auslender as he reviews the policies enacted in three German cities.

title: Integrating contemporary social values into heritage management and conservation practice: towards an organisational approach
isSeriesChild: Centre for Environment Heritage and Policy Seminar Series
summary: How does an institution’s responsibility to conserve historic places for the future take account of their significance to people in the present? Siân Jones and Elizabeth Robson examine this question through a research project with the National Trust for Scotland.

title: Climate Café Listening Circle
summary: Join our Climate Café and talk about what our changing world means to you over a hot drink.

title: Boro Inspired Slow Stitching
summary: Join us for a relaxed evening session of slow stitching, inspired by the Japanese technique of Boro.

summary: Join us to explore Scotland with a welcome tour to Loch Lomond and the Trossachs national park.

title: Golden Years 70s Reunion
summary: Were you a University of Stirling student in the 70s? Come along to a special reunion for former students with a three-course meal at the Stirling Court Hotel.
location: Stirling Court Hotel, University of Stirling

title: Green Week 2025
summary: Green Week takes place every year and is an interactive week of events focused on sustainability, active travel, biodiversity, and waste reduction.

title: Roadside Repair Workshop
summary: Come along to learn how to safely deal with simple roadside repairs for your bike.

title: Green and Blue Space Sustainable Fashion Fayre
summary: Come along to our Sustainable Fashion Fayre to have a look at a wide range of clothing.

title: Natural paper and notebook making workshop
summary: Join Herbal Homestead and Create Club for a sustainable focused workshop in ‘sewing’ seeds of hope.

title: Community gardening session
summary: A community gardening session with a zero-waste twist. Learn ways in which we can use different materials to upcycle into creative ideas.

title: BioBlitz
summary: Join us for an immersive exploration of biodiversity at our BioBlitz event. Drop-in on one of our informative walks and embark on a scientific journey as we gather nature enthusiasts, citizen scientists, and curious minds for a day filled with discovery.
location: Meet outside the Atrium at the Loch Bridge

title: Sustainable and Active Travel Fayre
summary: Join us on the 11 March, 11:00am – 3:00pm in the Atrium, to browse our Sustainable and Active Travel Fayre.

title: Spring litter pick
summary: Grab gloves, rally your friends, and help us tidy up our green spaces. Join us for our Spring Litter Pick.
location: Outside the Student Union office in the Atrium

title: Dunk ‘n Discuss: Resource Revolution – Embracing the Circular Economy
summary: Join us for an enlightening roundtable at The Hive, where we dive into the transformative world of the Circular Economy.
location: The Hive, Scion House, Stirling University Innovation Park Stirling FK9 4LA

title: Level 2 Certificate in Understanding Environmental Sustainability
summary: Contribute to a more sustainable future and enhance your knowledge with this free online course (staff only).

title: Green and Blue Space Conservation Day with Dynamic Wood
summary: Come along to a Green and Blue Space educational and volunteering day to Dynamic Woods and help plant some trees.

title: Move Together: Embracing Active Travel in Our Community
summary: Join us in the Playhouse theatre for an evening of informative and inspirational talks around the theme of active travel.

title: Why Not Scotland?
summary: We are delighted to be hosting a screening and Q&A session of Why Not Scotland? - an exploration of rewilding a depleted landscape through the eyes of a young Scot.

title: Build a bird box for campus
summary: Build your very own bird box and keep up to date with birds using it for nesting on campus. Spaces are limited so book now.

title: Graduation ball June 2025
summary: Get your ticket to the June 2025 Graduation Ball and celebrate your achievements.
location: Stirling Court Hotel, University of Stirling

title: 16 Days of Activism
summary: 16 Days of Activism against gender-based violence is an annual international campaign that starts on 25 November and runs until 10 December. Find out what's happening at the University of Stirling.
location: Various locations across campus and online

title: Gender-based violence support and awareness showcase
summary: Join us in the Atrium for stalls and information about gender-based violence.

title: Led ride: women and non-binary people
summary: Join us for a fun, empowering bike ride and coffee around Stirling's beautiful surroundings.

title: United Steps, Strong Voices
summary: Walk around the loch with students and raise awareness for gender-based violence.

title: Understanding coercive control, the dark heart of domestic abuse
summary: Learn about coercive and controlling behaviours with this session by Stirling Women's Aid.

title: Be Connected
summary:
Discover a programme of free events and activities for our Stirling community of students and staff.
Bookings for activities will open approximately four to six weeks before the event date.

title: Free Eco Craft Workshops
summary: Come along and try a range of crafty activities throughout the semester, free of charge, and meet new people while doing so!
timeAdvice: Check below for dates and times of each workshop and location.

title: Money on Your Mind
summary: Feeling stressed about money and would like to understand more about how your spending habits affect your mental and physical health? Come along to our event and take the first steps towards improving your financial alongside your overall wellbeing.
timeAdvice: Pop along anytime between 11:00 and 15:00.

title: Miniature Horse Therapy
summary: Take a break from work, exams, study and pop by Haldane's grass area to meet a mini therapy horse! On campus every Sat from 19 April to 10 May.

title: Paws Against Stress (Therapets)
summary: Open to all University of Stirling students and staff, join our next Paws Against Stress (Therapets) event, on Saturday 1 March, delivered by volunteers of Canine Concern Scotland Trust.

title: Global Café
summary: International students: come along and join us for tea or coffee, make friends, chat and play games.
timeAdvice: Held every Monday

summary: Celebrate the beginning of the Year of the Snake at the University of Stirling!

summary: Celebrate a day of culture at the University of Stirling.

Saturday Iftars running on the 1, 8, 15 & 22 Mar.

summary: Come along for a fun and informative evening to learn about Scottish culture and customs, try traditional snacks, and make new friends!

summary: Join us for presentations on the Baha’i Faith and Writings.

summary: This event is now sold out. Join us for a celebration of Scottish culture while making new connections across the University.

summary: In recognition of Mental Health Awareness Week, there are lots of events and activities taking place at the University of Stirling for staff and students to get involved with.

summary: This High Intensity Interval Training session will focus on building stamina and strength, and gaining mobility all within your own space.

title: Slime making event
summary: Come by and make some slime with your RA team that you can personalize with glitter, sequins, beads and more!

title: Careers Essentials: Improving your Interview Technique
summary: Join our Careers Essentials ‘How to Improve’ workshops to build on your existing knowledge and apply it within the recruitment process.

summary: Soulspace is a time for sacred reflection, open to people of all faiths or none.

title: Expert advice for preventing stress
summary: Join this event for expert advice on how to prevent stress.

summary: Book your place for a 30-minute health MOT.

title: Bob Ross Paint Night
summary: Meet in the Juniper Court Social space for a night of painting and warm beverages!

title: Places of peace on campus, the Labyrinth
summary: Set aside time for some quiet inner reflection and connection to nature.

title: Strength and tone circuits
summary: Join this event for 30 minutes of dynamic strength and toning combinations.

title: Chappy's Chatty Hour
summary: Join Lesley, Chappy the bear and friends at the Chaplaincy for an hour of conversation and fun on a Friday lunchtime.

title: Paws Against Stress
summary: Pop along to our next Paws Against Stress session on the 9 November at Campus Central Level 3 and meet some lovely pups!

title: Seasonal Yoga
summary: Cool things down with Seasonal Yoga, a dynamic practice designed to keep you in balance with nature's changing energies.

title: Zumbathon dance party
summary: Join Andrea for a Fun-filled, Zumba party with music and dances from all over the world.

title: Climate Cafe listening circle
summary: Climate Cafes are non-judgemental and non-action-based spaces for people to talk about how the climate crisis makes them feel.

title: Pickleball
summary: Pickleball is a fun racket sport that combines elements of tennis, table tennis, and badminton - equipment provided!

title: Badminton
summary: Join us for a casual game of badminton in a friendly, inclusive environment.

title: Staff tennis
summary: Join us on the court to play some staff tennis, equipment is provided if needed!

summary: Try out badminton, table tennis and pickleball in our drop-in session for staff.

title: Wellbeing Week
summary: Celebrate all things wellbeing with our special programme of activities and events.

title: Desk mobility session
summary: Say goodbye to the sedentary slump and embrace a dynamic session designed to counter the effects of prolonged desk sitting.

title: Baha’i wellbeing meditation
summary: Unwind at lunchtime with a meditation based on Baha’i teachings.

title: UV dodgeball
summary: Dodgeball with a difference - it's glow in the dark! Come along and try this fun version of the popular game.

title: Staff tennis
summary: Join staff for tennis games - all abilities are welcome!

title: Yoga for strength
summary: Try our yoga for strength session to promote your alignment, strength, balance, and flexibility.

title: Hot chocolate social at Alexander Court
summary: Meet the residence assistants and site staff in our hot chocolate social.
location: Alexander Court Courtyard (look out for the gazebo)
timeAdvice: Accommodation staff are welcome to join the event

title: Legs, bums, and tums
summary: Target the lower body and core muscles with our legs, bums, and tums class.

title: Taylor Swift pilates
summary: Your regular pilates class with a Swifty sound track. Free for all students.

title: Wellbeing stall
summary: Visit the wellbeing stall where you can pick up information about the wellbeing support available on campus. Students will get a free fruit pot!

title: Silent book group
summary: Join our Silent Book Group in the library. It's the perfect opportunity to enjoy some quiet reading time and immerse yourself in a good book.

title: Strength and tone circuits
summary: The strength and tone circuits class helps you strengthen joints and sculpt muscles. This online event is available to all staff

title: Loch wellbeing walk with your residence assistants
summary: Step into nature and unwind with a peaceful walk around the loch led by the residence assistants.
timeAdvice: Accommodation staff are welcome to join the event

title: Herbal teas for common ailments and designing your own coaster workshop
summary: Enjoy a free herbal tea tasting and design your own unique coaster.

title: Planning for your future workshop
summary: The Planning for Your Future workshop is for any member of staff thinking of retiring. It covers all the essential things to consider when planning for the next stage of life.

title: Big games night
summary: Students and staff are invited to join our next big games night. Delivered in partnership with Common Ground Games, there will be several games to choose from as a group, in a relaxed environment

title: Halls table tennis
summary: Meet us at Juniper Court accommodation social space for a social game of table tennis with other students.

title: Multi-sport hall session
summary: Come along for a drop-in session including badminton, table tennis and pickleball for University staff in the sports hall.

title: Soulspace
summary: Soulspace is a time for sacred reflection, open to people of all faiths or none. The theme of the session is "shape".

title: Feel good movement
summary: Feel Good Movement is a transformative class designed to enhance your joint health, alleviate muscle tension, and provide a rejuvenating experience.

title: Bullet journaling and gratitude workshop
summary: Join us for an engaging session where you'll learn how to design a personalised journal to organise your thoughts, set goals, and track habits.
timeAdvice: Accommodation staff are welcome to join the event

title: Halls Pilates and yoga
summary: Come along to this Pilates and yoga session.

summary: Join us for a fun, hands-on Stress Ball Making Workshop as part of Wellbeing Week.

title: Gardening session
summary: All students are invited to come along to an afternoon of relaxing gardening in the community garden.

title: HIIT workout
summary: A High Intensity Interval Training session that will focus on building stamina and strength, gaining mobility all within your own space.

title: Staff health MOTs
summary: Book a 30-minute health MOT with recommendations on how to improve and support your mental health.

title: Encouragement stall
summary: Spread positivity at our encouragement stall.

title: Test your welbeing score
summary: Discover your wellness age with simple tests at the Sports Centre.
location: Fitness Suite, third floor of Sports Centre
timeAdvice: Visit the Sports Centre reception to take part

title: Climate Café
summary: Join our safe space to express your thoughts, feelings, and fears about the climate and ecological crisis.
location: Green and Blue Space, Campus Central

title: MSc Digital Banking and Finance: April
summary: This Masters course gives you the knowledge and analytical skills you’ll need for a successful career in banking and finance in an increasingly digital world. Meet Course Director, Dr Michael Watts, to find out more about the course.

title: MRes Business and Management
summary:
This course is accredited by the Economic and Social Research Council (ESRC) and the Scottish Graduate School of Social Science for the training of PhD students.

If you are interested in joining this course for the September 2025 intake, attending this session is strongly recommended.

title: LLM Environmental Law and Climate Justice: April
summary: Join Course Director, Professor Annalisa Savaresi, to find out more about our LLM Environmental Law and Climate Justice and get answers to any questions you might have about studying at Stirling.

title: MSc Psychological Research Methods: April
summary: Our Psychological Research Methods course combines training in psychological theory with practical research skills development. Join the webinar to hear more from the Course Director, Professor Craig Roberts.

title: MSc Substance Use (Online): March
summary: Our MSc Substance Use is ideal for current practitioners looking to develop/further their career in the field of substance use, as well as for individuals looking to build on their undergraduate studies. Join lecturer, Dr Danielle Mitchell to learn more about the course.

title: Postgraduate Publishing Studies courses: April
summary: Join Course Director, Dr Caroline Wintersgill, and Lecturer, Dr Louisa Preston, to find out about our MLitt and MRes Publishing Studies courses led by the Stirling Centre for International Publishing and Communication - a world-leading centre for postgraduate study in publishing.

title: MSc Social Work Studies
summary: This course is taught by qualified social workers and accredited by the Scottish Social Services Council. You'll gain experience and qualify as a skilled social worker with two supervised practice placements.

title: International Introduction to Stirling: April
summary: Join our International Recruitment Team to find out more about studying at the University of Stirling. They'll also provide advice about applying to Stirling.

title: MSc Sport Performance Coaching: April
summary: Join Course Director, Stephen Macdonald to find out more about our online Masters in Sport Performance Coaching at Scotland's University for Sporting Excellence.

title: MSc Gerontology and Global Ageing webinar
summary: Find out more about the MSc Gerontology and Global Ageing course, which will give you an advanced understanding of the ageing of individuals and populations. You'll be able to take what you learn into your workplace and enhance your professional development.

title: MSc Dementia Studies: April 2025
summary: Join the longest-running provider of online postgraduate qualifications in dementia studies to learn more about this course run by a team of academic experts whose research has shaped dementia care policies worldwide.

title: MSc Sport Management: April
summary: Kick-start your sports career with a Masters in Sport Management from Scotland's University for Sporting Excellence. Our Masters includes a placement within sport organisations. Join Course Director, Dr Claudio Rocha, to hear more information about the course.

title: MSc Education: April
summary: Our Masters in Education is designed for established educationalists, aiming to advance their understanding of education, as well as those looking to convert their career to this field. Meet Course Director, Dr Kay Sidebottom to get lots more information about the course.

title: UK postgraduate fees and funding
summary: Join Gemma Connell, Head of UK and EU Recruitment as we go through all you need to know about the fees and funding opportunities for you. From available loans and scholarships to learning about payment plans, it’s your chance to learn more and ask your questions.

title: Doctor of Education
summary: Enhance your research expertise with our Doctor of Education. It's tailored to the needs of senior professionals and allows you to put your research into practice.

title: Doctor of Applied Social Research
summary: Open up more career opportunities with our Doctor of Applied Social Research and gain high-quality research skills that can be applied in the workplace. Our course is flexible and attendance is kept to a minimum so you can fit it around your career.

title: Introduction to Stirling: May
summary: Our International Recruitment Team is here to share what it's like to study at the University of Stirling and advise you on how to submit your application.

title: Overseas funding and scholarships
summary: Looking for information on funding your studies and available scholarships? Join us to learn more as this webinar aims to offer advice on everything from payment plans to available funding opportunities.

title: Postgraduate accommodation
summary: Join Kirsten Berry, Accommodation Administration Co-ordinator, to learn all about accommodation for postgraduate students at the University of Stirling. We’ll take you through the accommodation form to make it simple and stress-free.

title: Careers and employability
summary: We’re here to offer the best possible advice when it comes to finding relevant work - find out how a degree at Stirling can prepare you for your career.

title: Virtual Undergraduate Open Day: Introduction to Stirling and student panel
summary: Join our Head of UK and EU Recruitment, Gemma Connell, for an engaging introduction to the University of Stirling. You’ll explore why Stirling is an exceptional place to study, live, and prepare for your future. Hear from current students about their experiences, uncover the opportunities waiting for you, and get answers to your questions.

title: Virtual Undergraduate Open Day: How to apply and write your personal statement
summary: Ali Clark, Head of Student Recruitment, will help you navigate the application process for our undergraduate courses. You’ll get expert advice on crafting a standout UCAS personal statement. For international students, Ali will also be sharing tips on how to apply through systems like the Common Application.

title: Virtual Undergraduate Open Day: International students
summary: Meet our International Recruitment Team and learn more about undergraduate studies at the University of Stirling as an international student. Ask questions and learn about what it’s like to study with us, the application process and funding opportunities.

title: Virtual Undergraduate Open Day: Tuition fees and funding for UK students
summary: Join Alan Waddell, Student Recruitment Manager, for this essential session on tuition fees and funding for undergraduate students from the UK (Scotland, England, Northern Ireland, and Wales). Learn about tuition fee options, how to apply for government funding, and the scholarships available to support your studies.

title: Virtual Undergraduate Open Day: Student support and accommodation
summary: Join Student Support and Accommodation teams to learn more about the support available to you during your studies and the options we offer if you would like to stay in University-managed housing. We’ll cover the wide range of student support services available, from wellbeing and academic guidance to financial advice and career support.

title: Virtual Undergraduate Open Day: Sport at Stirling
summary: David Bond, Head of Performance Sport, will talk about getting involved in sport during your time at the University of Stirling: as a performance athlete, part of a student-led team or a member of the gym. You'll also hear from our Faculty of Health Sciences and Sport to learn more about our Sports courses.
